channel.title: Snubs
channel.description: Film nerds and hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films snubbed at the Oscars. Alternating each week, one host must convince the other of their favorite films' deserved nomination. They discuss Oscar films and their competitive awards years, while also trying to make each other laugh.
channel.itunes:author: High Tops Media & Caroline Young, Chris Masciarelli

item.title: Blade Runner
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Ridley Scott’s, Blade Runner, and the 1983 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline thinks Harrison Ford is for the girls and Chris is upset over the eye gouging scenes. They both actually have an intelligent conversation as well, which is a first.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

item.title: Emmys 2022 Recap
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, usually discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this special episode, our titular hosts recap the 2022 Emmys, and the surprise moments everyone can’t stop talking about. They also discuss some of the shows nominated, and which series and stars may have been snubbed this year. They recorded right after the show, so are both tired but excited to talk about one of their favorite events of the year. Chris could not be more happy for Michael Keaton, and Caroline believes Bill Hader was robbed.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

item.title: History of the World: Part I (+ Venice Film Festival Recap)
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Mel Brooks’ History of the World: Part I, and the 1982 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. They also will be discussing the 2022 Venice International Film Festival, notably the Don’t Worry Darling drama that has been taking the internet by storm. Caroline absolutely roasts Chris for his movie choice, and Chris needs to do penance for throwing the pod off its rhythm.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

item.title: The Perks Of Being A Wallflower
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts, along with special guest Ryan Young (Caroline’s brother), discuss the teen drama The Perks of Being a Wallflower, and the 2013 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline sees herself in Emma Watson’s character (if she squints really really hard), Chris is a sucker for sentimentality, and Ryan has an unusual tunnel song.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!

item.title: Wild Card: When Harry Met Sally.../Gone Girl
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this special Wild Card episode, our titular hosts discuss Rob Reiner’s When Harry Met Sally… and David Fincher’s Gone Girl, and the Academy Awards they were noticeably absent from. Usually these films are ineligible, but this week we made an exception. Caroline thinks Amy Dunne may have had a point, and Chris may riot if they ever tried to remake When Harry Met Sally.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts, along with a panel of guests (Taylor Fried, Hailey Aldrich, Lizzy Smith, Julia Bertussi, and Kristian Labrie), discuss Stanley Kubrick’s The Shining and the 1981 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline hesitantly breaks pod dogma for this episode, and Chris wishes there was a Jack Nicholson cameo in Spotlight.

item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts, along with special guest Gavin Berger, discuss George Lucas’s Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith and the 2006 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline doesn’t know why we are doing this episode, Chris can’t stop doing an Emperor Palpatine impression, and Gavin just wants to talk about The Clone Wars.

item.title: Oscars 2022 Recap
item.description:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, are joined by special guest Ana Tressel to recap the 2022 Oscars and the slap everyone can’t stop talking about. They also discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Academy this year, and where they’d make some changes. Chris’s allergies make him sound like he’s been chain smoking for 80 years, Caroline can’t believe the 3 hour Japanese Best Picture nominee was watched without her, and Ana wants Emma Stone and Andrew Garfield to get back together.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media
